BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE TRADITION OF THE PALM BEACHES INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OPERATION OF A SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY THAT PROVIDES A FULL COMPLEMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY THAT PROVIDES A FULL COMPLEMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: THE TRADITION'S INDEPENDENT AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY INCLUDES 144 UNITS, INCLUDING STUDIO, ONE- AND TWO-BEDROOM APARTMENTS. RESIDENTS HAVE THE OPTION TO ENHANCE THEIR LIVING ARRANGEMENT WITH EXTRA LEVELS OF CARE THAT PROVIDES ADDITIONAL HANDS-ON CARE. SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE MEALS, NURSING CARE, RECREATION, AND SOCIAL SERVICES. ALL ASSISTED LIVING RESIDENTS ARE AT RISK FOR LONG-TERM CARE (SKILLED NURSING FACILITY PLACEMENT). THE ASSISTED LIVING ENVIRONMENT (AVERAGE AGE 90+) IS INSTRUMENTAL IN AVOIDING AND/OR DELAYING PLACEMENT IN AN INSTITUTIONAL SETTING. THE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE LEVIN TOWER, A 182 UNIT INDEPENDENT LIVING FACILITY, IN 2018.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVENUE REPORTED AS EXPENSE ON THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 9,101.
REVENUE REPORTED AS EXPENSE ON THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS -9,101.

MORSELIFE HEALTH CENTER, INC. MAINTAINS TWO NONQUALIFIED EMPLOYEE DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLANS OPEN TO CERTAIN KEY EMPLOYEES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE 457(B) AND SECTION 457(F) (COLLECTIVELY, THE 457 PLANS). THE 457 PLANS PROVIDE, AMONG OTHER THINGS, FOR VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTIONS TO BE MADE BY ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS. THESE FUNDS REMAIN THE PROPERTY OF MORSELIFE HEALTH CENTER, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES. MORSELIFE HEALTH CENTER, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES HAVE A FIDUCIARY DUTY OF ACCOUNTABILITY FOR THESE FUNDS. KEY EXECUTIVE, KEITH MYERS, PARTICIPATES IN THE DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN UNDER IRC SEC. 457(F). JOSEPH L. MORSE HEALTH CENTER, INC. MADE CONTRIBUTIONS ON BEHALF OF KEITH MYERS TO THE PLAN IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000 FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2017. JOSEPH L. MORSE HEALTH CENTER, INC. MADE CONTRIBUTIONS ON BEHALF OF THE FOLLOWING LISTED EMPLOYEES THAT PARTICIPATED IN THE DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN UNDER IRC SEC. 457(B). CHAE, HONG - $8,609. MYERS, KEITH - $4,996. JONES, JOHN - $16,155

KEITH MYERS, PRESIDENT AND CEO, HAS AN INCENTIVE/BONUS CLAUSE IN HIS EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT WITH MORSELIFE HEALTH CENTER, INC. (A RELATED ORGANIZATION). THE INCENTIVE/BONUS IS BASED ON INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE, AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PALM BEACH COUNTY HEALTH FACILITIES AUTHORITY
PALM BEACH COUNTY HEALTH FACILITIES AUTHORITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, COLUMN A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TOTAL PROCEEDS FOR SERIES 2016 BOND ISSUE ARE NOT IDENTICAL TO THE ISSUE PRICE LISTED IN PART I, COLUMN (E), THE DIFFERENCE IS $41,160,000 REPORTED ON THE RELATED ENTITY, JOSEPH L. MORSE HEALTH CENTER, INC.

ON DECEMBER 16, 2016, THE GROUP ENTERED INTO A CONSTRUCTION LOAN AGREEMENT WITH A BORROWING CAPACITY OF UP TO $19,200,000 SERIES 2016 BONDS, WITH A SYNDICATE OF FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS (THE "SERIES 2016 BONDS"), THROUGH THE PALM BEACH COUNTY HEALTH FACILITIES AUTHORITY. THE PROCEEDS FROM THE SERIES 2016 BONDS WERE USED TO FINANCE THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE LEVIN TOWER'S SECOND PHASE. AT MAY 31, 2017, THE GROUP HAD DRAWN APPROXIMATELY $4,033,000 AGAINST THE SERIES 2016 BONDS. DURING THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2018, THE GROUP MADE ADDITIONAL DRAWS OF APPROXIMATELY $14,872,000 ON THE SERIES 2016 BONDS. THE SERIES 2016 BONDS ARE COLLATERALIZED BY SUBSTANTIALLY ALL ASSETS, REVENUES, INCOME, AND RECEIPTS OF THE GROUP.

ON SEPTEMBER 25, 2015, THE GROUP BORROWED $72,000,000 OF SERIES 2015A BONDS AND ENTERED INTO A CONSTRUCTION LOAN AGREEMENT WITH A $66,000,000 BORROWING CAPACITY OF SERIES 2015B BONDS, WITH A SYNDICATE OF FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS (COLLECTIVELY, THE "SERIES 2015 BONDS"), THROUGH THE PALM BEACH COUNTY HEALTH FACILITIES AUTHORITY. THE PROCEEDS FROM THE SERIES 2015A BONDS WERE USED TO REFINANCE ITS SERIES 2012 BONDS, WHILE THE SERIES 2015B BONDS WERE USED TO FINANCE THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE LEVIN TOWER'S INITIAL PHASE. DURING THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2018, THE GROUP MADE ADDITIONAL DRAWS OF APPROXIMATELY $16,441,000 ON THE SERIES 2015B BONDS. THE SERIES 2015 BONDS ARE COLLATERALIZED BY SUBSTANTIALLY ALL ASSETS, REVENUES, INCOME, AND RECEIPTS OF THE GROUP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MORSELIFE HEALTH SYSTEM, INC. IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE TRADITION OF THE PALM BEACHES, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER, MORSELIFE HEALTH SYSTEM, INC., SHALL ELECT BOARD MEMBERS AND AT ANY TIME IN ITS SOLE DISCRETION, REMOVE AND NAME A REPLACEMENT FOR ANY BOARD MEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MORSELIFE HEALTH SYSTEM, INC. IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE TRADITION OF THE PALM BEACHES, INC. AND, AS SUCH, ELECTS THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND HAS ULTIMATE VOTING AND VETO AUTHORITY OVER THE TRADITION'S BOARD DECISIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMMITTEE, COMPOSED OF THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FROM EACH OF THE MORSELIFE RELATED ORGANIZATIONS AND THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE, IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990. THE CHAIRPERSON OF MORSELIFE HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. IS THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE COMMITTEE. THIS COMMITTEE MEETS ONE TIME PER YEAR. THE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DETAILED REVIEW OF ALL FORMS 990 FILED BY THE MORSE RELATED ENTITIES. THE FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE REPORTING ORGANIZATION. THE 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES ALL BOARD MEMBERS TO SUBMIT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE STATEMENTS, WHEN COMPLETED AND RETURNED, ARE REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT TO ENSURE THAT THERE ARE NO INADVERTENT CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TRADITION OF THE PALM BEACHES, INC. IS AN ORGANIZATION CONTROLLED BY MORSELIFE HEALTH SYSTEM, INC. MORSELIFE HEALTH SYSTEM, INC.'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF THE BOARD MEMBERS. THIS COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SEARCH, SELECTION, CONTRACT NEGOTIATION, PERFORMANCE REVIEWS, BENEFITS, AND ANNUAL SALARY INCREASES OF THE PRESIDENT & CEO POSITION. THE INITIAL CONTRACT NEGOTIATIONS OF THE PRESIDENT & CEO POSITION WERE BASED ON THE COMMITTEE'S REVIEW OF SIMILAR ENTITIES COMPENSATION PACKAGES FOR THE TOP OFFICIAL BASED ON THOSE ENTITIES' PUBLISHED IRS FORM 990. IN ADDITION, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE SUBSCRIBES AND PARTICIPATES IN SEVERAL INDEPENDENT SALARY SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY NATIONAL ASSOCIATIONS & OTHER PROVIDER ENTITIES AND UTILIZES THE FINDINGS OF THESE SURVEYS TO ENSURE COMPARABILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF THE PRESIDENT/CEO COMPENSATION PACKAGE. THE COMMITTEE MEETS AT LEAST ANNUALLY TO CONDUCT A PERFORMANCE REVIEW OF THE PRESIDENT/CEO. PERFORMANCE IS BASED ON PREVIOUSLY ESTABLISHED METRICS AND BENCHMARKS AND THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THESE GOALS IS THE BASIS FOR FINANCIAL INCENTIVE, BONUS AND ANNUAL SALARY INCREASE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DOCUMENTS THEIR MEETINGS WITH WRITTEN MINUTES, AS WELL AS MEMOS TO THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE, WITH INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION. THE PRESIDENT & CEO OF THE ORGANIZATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE COMPENSATION OF THE MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE TEAM, INCLUDING THE SR. VICE PRESIDENTS AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. ANNUAL INCREASES AND BASE SALARY AMOUNTS ARE COMPARED TO THE COMPENSATION PACKAGES FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS UTILIZING OTHER SIMILAR ENTITIES' PUBLISHED IRS FORM 990. IN ADDITION, INDEPENDENT SALARY SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY NATIONAL ASSOCIATIONS & OTHER PROVIDER ENTITIES ARE UTILIZED TO ENSURE COMPARABILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS. THE PRESIDENT & CEO REPORTS ON THE ANNUAL INCREASE, SALARY ADJUSTMENT, AND/OR CHANGE IN BENEFIT PACKAGE FOR THE EXECUTIVE TEAM MEMBERS TO THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MADE UP OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT: THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT, COMPLIANCE AND ETHICS COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM AND OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE WAS NO CHANGE IN THIS PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
